meanings.definition: In a frightening or alarming manner.
meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm approached scarily, making everyone hide indoors.
meanings.sent2: The horror movie was so scarily intense that I had to cover my eyes.
meanings.sent3: The haunted house tour guide laughed scarily to spook the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The shadowy figure moved scarily through the fog, sending shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence of the abandoned building felt scarily ominous.

meanings.sent1: The sudden loud noise scarily startled the sleeping cat.
meanings.sent2: Her ghost story always manages to scarily unsettle her friends.
meanings.sent3: The prankster scarily jumped out from behind the door, scaring everyone.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected twist in the plot scarily shocked the audience.
meanings.sent5: The howling wind scarily rattled the windows, creating a spooky atmosphere.
